layer.name: Order
layer.definition: Reality has patterns that can be discovered and used.

answers.4: generally — they signal something worth attending to
answers.5: absolutely — emotions are reliable signals about reality
answers.2: possibly — but they're hard to interpret
answers.3: sometimes — some emotions seem meaningful, others don't
answers.1: not really — they're just random noise

questions.text: Emotional patterns can be understood and interpreted ...

answers.4: mostly — with attention, emotions become readable
answers.5: reliably — there's a logic to emotional life that can be learned
answers.3: partially — some patterns are clear, others aren't
answers.1: not really — emotions are too chaotic to understand

questions.text: Emotions consistently point to something — unmet needs, violated values, important truths ...

answers.4: usually — emotions are generally connected to something real
answers.5: always — emotions are designed to reveal what matters
answers.2: maybe — but the link is fuzzy
answers.3: sometimes — some emotions clearly point somewhere, others don't
answers.1: I don't see the connection — they just happen

questions.text: The idea that emotions are meaningless chemical fluctuations is ...

answers.4: mostly wrong — emotions are meaningful signals, not just chemistry
answers.5: completely wrong — emotions carry real information about reality
answers.2: possibly true — emotions might just be brain chemistry
answers.3: partly true — there's biology, but maybe also meaning
answers.1: probably accurate — we're just biological machines

questions.text: There is an ordered path to emotional health ...

answers.4: mostly — there are principles that generally work
answers.5: absolutely — emotional health follows discoverable patterns
answers.2: possibly — but I don't know what it is
answers.3: partially — some aspects can be worked on, others can't
answers.1: not really — emotional health is luck or genetics

remediation.advice: If emotions feel random and overwhelming, start treating them as data. Ask: 'What is this feeling telling me?' Emotions have logic — they're responding to something. Find the pattern and you find meaning.

scripture.text: Anxiety in a man's heart weighs him down, but a good word makes him glad.
